description: Lenart Kova, after witnessing escalating unrest and stalled reconciliation, accesses the hidden vault and reviews both the assembly control option and the secret BCI forgiveness protocol left by Halden.
Lenart initiates activation of the forgiveness protocol. The system begins securely logging confession forum data, preparing to recalculate BCI scores citywide.

The BCI instantly recalibrates: those who confessed at public forums see their scores and privileges restored, while individuals found concealing actions or faking confessions are sharply penalized. The city reacts with shock and rapid reshuffling of social roles.

Protests erupt among penalized residents, claiming unfair treatment, while restored citizens organize spontaneous gatherings celebrating their reinstated status. New alliances and local leaders emerge from among the previously marginalized.

Oksana Lintz reveals that the forgiveness mechanism was embedded in Halden's earliest system pilots, intended to shift BCI from pure control toward societal healing. This revelation sparks public debate about reconciliation, further undermining the Council's authority.
